007package renderer.models_F;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.Face;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a wireframe model of a regular octahedron
015   with its center at the origin, having side length
016   {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},with its center plane given
017   by the four vertices {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with
018   the top and bottom vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
019<p>
020   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octahedron" target="_top">
021                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octahedron</a>
022
023   @see Tetrahedron
024   @see Cube
025   @see Icosahedron
026   @see Dodecahedron
027*/
028public class Octahedron extends Model implements MeshMaker
029{
030   public final int n1;
031   public final int n2;
032   public final int n3;
033
034   /**
035      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
036      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
037      with its center plane given by the four vertices
038      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
039      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
040   */
041   public Octahedron()
042   {
043      super("Octahedron");
044
045      this.n1 = 0;
046      this.n2 = 0;
047      this.n3 = 0;
048
049      // Create the octahedron's geometry.
050      // It has 6 vertices, 12 edges, and 8 faces.
051      addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  0,  0),  // 4 vertices around the center plane
052                new Vertex( 0,  0, -1),
053                new Vertex(-1,  0,  0),
054                new Vertex( 0,  0,  1),
055                new Vertex( 0,  1,  0),  // vertex at the top
056                new Vertex( 0, -1,  0)); // vertex at the bottom
057/*
058      // These vertices create an Octahedron with side length 1.
059      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
060      final double sqrt2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
061      addVertex(new Vertex( 0.5, 0,  0.5), // 4 vertices around the center plane
062                new Vertex(-0.5, 0,  0.5),
063                new Vertex(-0.5, 0, -0.5),
064                new Vertex( 0.5, 0, -0.5),
065                new Vertex( 0,  1/sqrt2, 0),  // vertex at the top
066                new Vertex( 0, -1/sqrt2, 0)); // vertex at the bottom
067*/
068      // Create eight triangular faces.
069      // Make sure the faces are all
070      // oriented in the same way!
071      // Remember that front facing
072      // should be counter-clockwise
073      // (and back facing is clock-wise).
074      addPrimitive(new Face(4, 1, 0),  // top half
075                   new Face(4, 0, 3),
076                   new Face(4, 2, 1),
077                   new Face(4, 3, 2),
078                   new Face(5, 0, 1),  // bottom half
079                   new Face(5, 3, 0),
080                   new Face(5, 1, 2),
081                   new Face(5, 2, 3));
082   }
083
084
085   /**
086      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
087      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
088      with its center plane given by the four vertices
089      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
090      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
091      <p>
092      Add line segments fanning out from the top and bottom
093      vertices to the sides around the center plane.
094
095      @param n number of lines fanning out from the top and bottom on each side of the octahedron
096      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
097   */
098   public Octahedron(final int n)
099   {
100      this(n, 0, 0);
101   }
102
103
104   /**
105      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
106      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
107      with its center plane given by the four vertices
108      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
109      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
110      <p>
111      Add line segments fanning out from each vertex to
112      its opposite sides.
113
114      @param n1 number of lines fanning out from the top and bottom on each side of the octahedron
115      @param n2 number of lines fanning out from v0 and v2 on each side of the octahedron
116      @param n3 number of lines fanning out from v1 and v3 on each side of the octahedron
117      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1} is less than 0
118      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2} is less than 0
119      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n3} is less than 0
120   */
121   public Octahedron(final int n1, final int n2, final int n3)
122   {
123      this(n1, n1, n2, n2, n3, n3);
124   }
125
126
127   /**
128      Create a regular octahedron with its center at the
129      origin, having side length {@code  sqrt(2) = 1.4142},
130      with its center plane given by the four vertices
131      {@code  (±1, 0, ±1)}. and with the top and bottom
132      vertices being {@code  (0, ±1, 0)}.
133      <p>
134      Add line segments fanning out from each vertex to
135      its opposite sides.
136
137      @param n1a number of lines fanning out from the top on each side of the octahedron
138      @param n1b number of lines fanning out from the bottom on each side of the octahedron
139      @param n2a number of lines fanning out from v0 on each side of the octahedron
140      @param n2b number of lines fanning out from v1 on each side of the octahedron
141      @param n3a number of lines fanning out from v2 on each side of the octahedron
142      @param n3b number of lines fanning out from v3 on each side of the octahedron
143      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1a} is less than 0
144      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1b} is less than 0
145      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2a} is less than 0
146      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2b} is less than 0
147      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n3a} is less than 0
148      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n3b} is less than 0
149   */
150   public Octahedron(final int n1a, final int n1b,
151                     final int n2a, final int n2b,
152                     final int n3a, final int n3b)
153   {
154      super(String.format("Octahedron(%d,%d,%d,%d,%d,%d)",n1a,n1b,n2a,n2b,n3a,n3b));
155
156      if (n1a < 0)
157         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n1a must be greater than or equal to 0");
158      if (n1b < 0)
159         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n1b must be greater than or equal to 0");
160      if (n2a < 0)
161         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n2a must be greater than or equal to 0");
162      if (n2b < 0)
163         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n2b must be greater than or equal to 0");
164      if (n3a < 0)
165         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n3a must be greater than or equal to 0");
166      if (n3b < 0)
167         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n3b must be greater than or equal to 0");
168
169      this.n1 = n1a;
170      this.n2 = n2a;
171      this.n3 = n3a;
172
173      // Create the octahedron's geometry.
174      // It has 6 vertices and 12 edges.
175      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( 1,  0,  0); // 4 vertices around the center plane
176      final Vertex v1 = new Vertex( 0,  0, -1);
177      final Vertex v2 = new Vertex(-1,  0,  0);
178      final Vertex v3 = new Vertex( 0,  0,  1);
179      final Vertex v4 = new Vertex( 0,  1,  0); // vertex at the top
180      final Vertex v5 = new Vertex( 0, -1,  0); // vertex at the bottom
181      addVertex(v0, v1, v2, v3, v4, v5);
182/*
183      // These vertices create an Octahedron with side length 1.
184      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
185      final double sqrt2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
186      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( 0.5, 0,  0.5); // 4 vertices around the center plane
187      final Vertex v1 = new Vertex(-0.5, 0,  0.5);
188      final Vertex v2 = new Vertex(-0.5, 0, -0.5);
189      final Vertex v3 = new Vertex( 0.5, 0, -0.5);
190      final Vertex v4 = new Vertex( 0,  1/sqrt2, 0); // vertex at the top
191      final Vertex v5 = new Vertex( 0, -1/sqrt2, 0); // vertex at the bottom
192      addVertex(v0, v1, v2, v3, v4, v5);
193*/
194      // Create eight triangular faces.
195      // Make sure the faces are all
196      // oriented in the same way!
197      // Remember that front facing
198      // should be counter-clockwise
199      // (and back facing is clock-wise).
200      addPrimitive(new Face(4, 1, 0),  // top half
201                   new Face(4, 0, 3),
202                   new Face(4, 2, 1),
203                   new Face(4, 3, 2),
204                   new Face(5, 0, 1),  // bottom half
205                   new Face(5, 3, 0),
206                   new Face(5, 1, 2),
207                   new Face(5, 2, 3));
208
209      // The faces fanning out from the top an bottom seem
210      // to be oriented correctly. Each set of faces fanning
211      // out from a vertex are oriented the same. But at least
212      // one set of faces seems to be oriented opposite of what
213      // it should be.
214      fan(n1a, 4,  0, 1, 2, 3); // fan out from v4 (top)
215      fan(n1b, 5,  3, 2, 1, 0); // fan out from v5 (bottom)
216      fan(n2a, 0,  3, 4, 1, 5); // fan out from v0
217      fan(n3a, 1,  0, 4, 2, 5); // fan out from v1
218      fan(n2b, 2,  1, 4, 3, 5); // fan out from v2
219      fan(n3b, 3,  2, 4, 0, 5); // fan out from v3
220   }
221
222
223   /**
224      Create {@code n} line segments fanning out from {@link Vertex}
225      {@code v0} towards the four edges spanned by the other four
226      vertices.
227
228      @param n    number of lines fanning out from {@link Vertex} {@code v0}
229      @param v0   index in the {@link Vertex} list of the vertex to fan out from
230      @param v1i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
231      @param v2i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
232      @param v3i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
233      @param v4i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
234   */
235   private void fan(final int n, final int v0, final int v1i,
236                                               final int v2i,
237                                               final int v3i,
238                                               final int v4i)
239   {
240      final Vertex v1 = vertexList.get(v1i);
241      final Vertex v2 = vertexList.get(v2i);
242      final Vertex v3 = vertexList.get(v3i);
243      final Vertex v4 = vertexList.get(v4i);
244
245      // Create vertices along the edge from v1 to v2.
246      int index = vertexList.size();
247      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
248      {
249         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
250         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
251         final double x = (1-t) * v1.x + t * v2.x;
252         final double y = (1-t) * v1.y + t * v2.y;
253         final double z = (1-t) * v1.z + t * v2.z;
254         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
255      }
256      // Create n faces.
257      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Face(v0, v1i, index));
258      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
259      {
260         addPrimitive(new Face(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
261      }
262
263
264      // Create vertices along the edge from v2 to v3.
265      index = vertexList.size();
266      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
267      {
268         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
269         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
270         final double x = (1-t) * v2.x + t * v3.x;
271         final double y = (1-t) * v2.y + t * v3.y;
272         final double z = (1-t) * v2.z + t * v3.z;
273         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
274      }
275      // Create n faces.
276      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Face(v0, v2i, index));
277      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
278      {
279         addPrimitive(new Face(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
280      }
281
282
283      // Create vertices along the edge from v3 to v4.
284      index = vertexList.size();
285      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
286      {
287         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
288         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
289         final double x = (1-t) * v3.x + t * v4.x;
290         final double y = (1-t) * v3.y + t * v4.y;
291         final double z = (1-t) * v3.z + t * v4.z;
292         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
293      }
294      // Create n faces.
295      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Face(v0, v3i, index));
296      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
297      {
298         addPrimitive(new Face(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
299      }
300
301
302      // Create vertices along the edge from v4 to v1.
303      index = vertexList.size();
304      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
305      {
306         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
307         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
308         final double x = (1-t) * v4.x + t * v1.x;
309         final double y = (1-t) * v4.y + t * v1.y;
310         final double z = (1-t) * v4.z + t * v1.z;
311         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
312      }
313      // Create n faces.
314      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Face(v0, v4i, index));
315      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
316      {
317         addPrimitive(new Face(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
318      }
319   }
320
321
322
323   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
324   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return this.n1;}
325
326   @Override public int getVertCount() {return this.n2;}
327
328   @Override
329   public Octahedron remake(final int n, final int k)
330   {
331      return new Octahedron(n, k, this.n3);
332   }
333}//Octahedron
